DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text name for a functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of an enzyme or other protein.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information pertaining to one of the bodies (normally 46 in humans) in the cell nucleus that is the bearer of genes, has the form of a delicate chromatin filament during interphase, contracts to form a compact cylinder segmented into two arms by the centromere during metaphase and anaphase stages of cell division, and is capable of reproducing its physical and chemical structure through successive cell divisions. In microbes, the chromosome is prokaryotic, not being enclosed within a nuclear membrane and not being subject to a mitotic mechanism.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of the bodies (normally 46 in humans) in the cell nucleus that is the bearer of genes, has the form of a delicate chromatin filament during interphase, contracts to form a compact cylinder segmented into two arms by the centromere during metaphase and anaphase stages of cell division, and is capable of reproducing its physical and chemical structure through successive cell divisions. In microbes, the chromosome is prokaryotic, not being enclosed within a nuclear membrane and not being subject to a mitotic mechanism.:A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of an enzyme or other protein. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule).

Concepts.definition: A structure found in cells that is comprised of a strand of linearized double-stranded DNA plus proteins that package the DNA in a condensed coil form and regulate chromosomal function.
A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position on a particular chromosome and serves as the template for a product that contributes to a phenotype or a biological function.

Property.preferredDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A protein or RNA whose structure is represented in and determined by genomic sequences.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of an enzyme or other protein. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule)._The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: This gene plays a role in the phase II metabolism of both endogenous compounds and xenobiotics.

Concepts.definition: This gene plays a role in the phase II metabolism of both endogenous compounds and xenobiotics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: This gene is involved in phase II metabolism of both endogenous compounds and xenobiotics.

Concepts.definition: This gene is involved in phase II metabolism of both endogenous compounds and xenobiotics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: This gene is involved in nucleotide excision repair and corrects sensitivity to UV radiation and defective nucleotide excision repair in xeroderma pigmentosum cells of complementation group D.

Concepts.definition: This gene is involved in nucleotide excision repair and corrects sensitivity to UV radiation and defective nucleotide excision repair in xeroderma pigmentosum cells of complementation group D.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: This gene is involved in folate metabolism and methionine biosynthesis.

Concepts.definition: This gene is involved in folate metabolism and methionine biosynthesis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: This gene is involved in pyrimidine catabolism.

Concepts.definition: This gene is involved in pyrimidine catabolism.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of a protein or other product. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: one of a series of possible alternative forms of a given gene, differing in DNA sequence, and affecting the functioning of a single product.:Variation; something that deviates from a norm or standard; an instance of change.:A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Mutually exclusive alternative forms of the same gene occupying the same locus on homologous chromosomes, differing in nucleotide sequence and governing the same biochemical and developmental process.
An alteration or difference from a norm or standard.
A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support Lombardi Cancer Center clinical trial
